abstract: BP said Wednesday that it would sell certain of its Malaysian assets to Petronas, the country’s oil consortium, for up to $411 million, as it begins to divest itself of businesses to recoup the costs of the Gulf oil spill.
snippet: BP said Wednesday that it would sell certain of its Malaysian assets to Petronas, the country’s oil consortium, for up to $411 million, as it begins to divest itself of businesses to recoup the costs of the Gulf oil spill.
lead_paragraph: BP said Wednesday that it would sell some of its Malaysian assets to Petronas, the country’s oil consortium, in a deal worth up to $411 million, as it begins to divest itself of businesses to recoup the costs of the Gulf oil spill.

headline.main: BP to Sell Malaysian Assets to Petronas
